newsitem.title: FRANCE: Two bomb attacks in Corsica, no one hurt-TV.
newsitem.headline: Two bomb attacks in Corsica, no one hurt-TV.

text.p: Two bomb attacks on Wednesday night caused heavy damage to the local chamber of commerce in the Corsican town of Bonifacio and to a state television installation in Porto Veccio, radio France-Info said.
No one was hurt in either attack and no one has claimed responsibility, the radio said.
Corsican separatist militants have carried out dozens of similar attacks, mostly against government buildings, on the troubled Mediterranean island in the past years.
